poem:
Title: "Morning Paper Musings"

In the grey spectrum of news and time,
Guterres echoes 'gainst AI and climate, a chime.
Gaza weeps, Blinken's heart aches, twined,
David Cameron's Brexit ghost, a specter unsigned.
To question strength and economy,
Is akin to doubting the constancy of the sea.
In words' strengths we confide,
A morning read, the day's profound guide.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Davos day two: Blinken says Gaza scenes are ‘gut-wrenching’; UN’s Guterres warns world failing on AI and climate crisis – business live 1.57pm GMT David Cameron can’t escape his responsibility for Britain’s exit from the European Union at Davos today. At the end of his session on supporting Ukraine, the foreign secretary is asked. Q: You talked about the strength of the UK economy – doesn’t that show you were wrong to warn that Brexit". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
